column1: MBTA Travel Pro enables users to track the real-time location and arrival/departure times for various routes mass transit routes in and around Boston. The app allows users to customize their view to quickly display their favorite line and real-time-updated location and wait time for the arrival of their particular travel mode: bus
column4: or boat. The application is specifically designed for Windows Phone 8 and above with seamless integration with phone operating system.\\r\

column1: [Late Night T Data Explorer by Matthew Danish]\\r\
How have usage patterns of the late night MBTA and Taxi services changed between 2013 and 2014? We can explore this question using these three interactive charts
column2: that provide several views of the late night T and Taxi data. Using the interactive charts
column3: users can select different slices of information to be presented. Compare year-over-year differences at various times of night
column6: or taxi-trip starting ZIP codes to view.\\r\

column1: Comparison is provided of comparable weekends year-over-year
column2: from February 28th up to early June
column3: to provide a glimpse of the change before and after the initiation of late night service on March 28th.\\r\

column1: A real-time view of the entire region and live-updating locations on transit vehicles\\r\
Interesting analysis of ridership and cost\\r\
The first MBTA travel info smartwatch app (and perhaps the first mass-transit smartwatch app in the nation!)\\r\
MassDOT and the MBTA are excited to announce a 12-week data challenge that will release the MBTA\'s late night ridership data as well as a new version of the API for the T\'s real-time data. \\r\

The goals of the challenge will be to highlight the MBTA\\u2019s late night service as well as see how it and other on-demand services such as Uber are contributing to Boston\'s culture shift towards later hours. The City of Boston is exploring how to offer more amenities later into the night to make itself a more attractive destination for people to live and work; one that is not restricted by traditional hours of operation.  MassDOT and the MBTA want to know how late night service is changing the way people think about accessing and traveling around the city. \\r\

column2: the MBTA has released a new API for real-time information. The new API is an exciting improvement for developers that currently access the MBTA\\u2019s real-time data
column3: because the common platform will allow for the visualization of all of our data on all modes side-by-side in one application. The new MBTA-realtime v2 API integrates predictions and alerts together for MBTA subway
column5: and bus in one easy-to-use interface. Check the GitHub site for information on the API\'s new formats
column6: calls and fields. They make it easier than ever to develop a wide variety of applications using MBTA data. Find out more on the API at the data challenge GitHub site:\\r\

Spartan Race and Hackfit have partnered to bring you a one-of-a-kind hacking experience with the ultimate prize of a partnership deal with Spartan Race to launch your application or device at a 2015 Reebok Spartan Race event. Each destination on the Spartan Hackathon Tour begins with a 24-hour hackathon and concludes with an adventurous Spartan Race where hacking teams will have the opportunity to band together and triumph over the course.\\r\

This data set is not a working API.\\r\
It it just a plain MySQL-Dump or file full of CSV-Values.\\r\
This data represents a simple search on one of our trivago platforms (like http://www.trivago.com/). \\r\
One search contains various properties like:\\r\
* Platform of the search (e.g. http://www.trivago.it or http://www.trivago.es/)\\r\
* City / Country / Continent which was searched\\r\
* Longitude / Latitude of the searched city\\r\
* Arrival / Departure date of the search\\r\
* and some information where the user comes from\\r\

column15: name:"Citizen audit of the Belgian e-voting system"
column17: description:"**PLEASE JOIN HACKER LEAGUE AND THE HACKATHON IF YOU\'RE PLANNING ON DROPPING BY**\\r\

column1: Living in a democracy implies that citizens can check the procedures of their government
column2: elections being their main participation in that democracy. Since e-voting has been introduced in Belgian elections
column3: citizens thus have to be able to double check these electronic methods.\\r\

column1: This is an open call for an open citizen audit of the Belgian e-voting systems
column2: to be held in Antwerp on Sunday Jun 15 2014

column1: What is the state of the Belgian e-voting system? \\r\

How and why did the Brussels voting fail? Is the code safe from fraud? Is the vote counting bullet proof? Is the software secure? Is communicated data securely and correctly encrypted/decrypted? Can the QR codes on the Smartmatic ballots be spoofed or are they vulnerable to fraudulent payloads? What other leaks or holes or security flaws can you detect in the voting system? Is e-voting vulnerable to attacks? Can it be improved?\\r\

The Belgian federal authorities of internal affairs (\\"Binnenlande Zaken\\") have published the source code of the e-voting on 28 May 2014 at http://www.ibz.rrn.fgov.be/index.php?id=3285&L=1 For faster downloads
column2: it is also available as a torrent at https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/63152/elections.torrent\\r\

column1: Although there is an independent expert team hard at work on a parliamentary requested audit
column2: we have started wondering what the citizens can do with the code base
column3: can we openly and ethically test its implementation ourselves? \\r\

column1: We\'re organising a hackathon to challenge the code base!\\r\
Please download the source code and start exploring right now
column2: you may be able to prepare something special to do at the event
column3: to share knowledge and to collaborate on projects on top of the code base. An audit is a first start. But playing Tetris on a voting machine would be cool

column1: If you are planning on dropping by
column2: please join Hacker League and join this event. You can create teams and projects with friends and colleagues. Please share your ideas as soon as you have them. Link to github repos

column1: As far as the day goes
column2: we may have an interesting talk on the state of e-voting in Belgium
column3: plenty of time to collaborate on studying the code
column4: and possibilities to spread the word on stuff you have learned.\\r\

column4: in the centre of Antwerp (see http://telenetidealabs.be/#contact)."

column30: name:"FlameMapper - Esri Climate Resilience App Challenge"
column32: description:"With current climate changes and extreme drought conditions in California
column33: now is the time to start implementing effective wildfire management technology. To demonstrate what can be done to combat wildfires
column34: the FlameMapper team will effectively configure and use sophisticated mathematical wildfire prediction programs by integrating the data with Esri\\u2019s technology and then display the data via a JavaScript API. The  innovative web-based platform will provide a proactive prediction tool for Local Governments as well as State Fire Departments. The team will further demonstrate the effectiveness of mitigation by proactively mapping Major Fire paths and wildland containment cells. FlameMapper is a patented web-based wildfire mapping platform that aims to provide the ability to predict where a wildfire will burn for firefighters
column35: emergency management personnel and anyone concerned for their own personal safety. FlameMapper was invented to utilize Esri\'s technology to provide an unprecedented preventative technological resource for wildfire safety. \\r\

column1: We are looking for 1-2 developers come join our team for the Esri Climate Resilience App Challenge. Great data combined with a great team wins events. We have the data
column2: all we need is the team. Come join our team
column19: description:"In June 2013 as part of [The Climate Action Plan](http://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/image/president27sclimateactionplan.pdf)
column20: President Obama announced the Climate Data Initiative
column21: an effort to encourage tech innovators to use data about climate change risks and impacts in compelling ways to help citizens
column23: and communities makes smart choices in the face of climate change. \\r\

column1: How are changes in weather patterns going to impact the world? How do we start preparing for these changes? What makes cities more resilient to climate change? Can you think of ways that we can solve these problems using geospatial data? You are encouraged to explore all aspects of the hurdles of climate resilience \\u2013 from tools to manage drought

Esri wants to help our President reach this goal. We encourage you to develop game changing apps that promote climate resilience. We continue to try to make a difference in the world and we know you do too. That\\u2019s why we\\u2019re challenging you to get creative for this important initiative! \\r\

column16: description:"Join us for the Texas Conference on Digital Libraries\' first-ever hackathon! We\'ll be developing tools that Texas libraries and others can freely use to power new and transformative explorations of our digitized cultural heritage
column17: based on the Digital Public Library of America (DPLA) API.\\r\

column1: DPLA is a platform that enables new and transformative uses of digitized cultural heritage materials
column2: based on a metadata repository that provides read-only access to millions of records from across the United States via an open API. Texas content is currently provided by the Portal to Texas History at the University of North Texas
column3: one of nine DPLA Service Hubs
column4: and by content contributed by DPLA Content Hubs. In this workshop
column5: participants will actively code against the DPLA API to build or enhance apps
column8: and other interesting tools that make use of DPLA data.\\r\

column1: The DPLA encourages the development of apps and tools by developers of all skill levels and backgrounds; there are no strict boundaries on the types of apps accepted
column2: except that they be open source (the DPLA platform is released under a AGPLv3 license) and interoperable with the DPLA platform.  DPLA API queries are returned as JSON-LD
column3: and the metadata is freely reusable under a CC0 public domain license. A front-end portal is currently available at <http://dp.la>; prospective workshop participants are encouraged to explore the portal to see what types of materials are available.\\r\

column1: This FREE hackathon will provide some background on DPLA and the DPLA API
column2: but it will not provide a structured introduction to programming. Active participation is highly desired
column3: so workshop participants should have at least some prior experience of working with APIs or with interface development in PHP
column6: or Java. Participants should provide their own laptop computers with appropriate development environments; power and wireless Internet access will be available courtesy of the Texas Digital Library and The University of Texas at Austin Libraries. \\r\

column1: Technical Notes: The DPLA codex is available at <http://dp.la/info/developers/codex/>. Participants should request an API Key prior to the workshop at <http://dp.la/info/developers/codex/policies/#get-a-key>. Please review the API Basics (<http://dp.la/info/developers/codex/api-basics/>) or browse the apps page (<http://dp.la/apps>) to see some examples of production apps. DPLA has made sample code and libraries for Python

column4: and our Developer API to you. \\r\

column1: What could you build with 20M products + 250M reviews and social content + 650M unique shoppers + an API + a mobile SDK? \\r\

column1: Mashup the Mashery APIs with [Intel XDK](http://xdk-software.intel.com) to build Cross-Platform Mobile apps. Get started building an HTML5 mobile app quickly by downloading the Intel XDK and using embedded Mashery sample apps for RESTful APIs such as Hotwire
#### What is the Mashery API Network?\\r\
The Mashery API Network allows you to register once and gain access to 40+ Mashery-powered RESTful APIs with a single sign-on. With over 245
column4: the Mashery API Network helps developers get started with APIs quickly and overcome common pain points during app development. \\r\

column1: Get to know the [best API evangelism team](http://masherydev.tumblr.com) in the business. Mashery\'s Developer Evangelists (meet [@mansillaDev](http://twitter.com/mansilladev) and [@amit](://twitter.com/amit)) would be on the ground at WIP Jam Hackathon to help you build some awesome apps. \\r\
Intel XDK is a cross-platform mobile development toolkit that allosw you to build Android
column2: iOS and Windows 8 apps using standard web frameworks. If you can write code in HTML5
column4: you can use the Intel XDK to build an HTML5 web app or a hybrid app for all of the major app stores.\\r\

column1: You can download the Intel XDK [here](http://xdk-software.intel.com)\\r\
#### What APIs are available from Mashery?\\r\
Plenty. Here\'s a [complete list of APIs](http://developer.mashery.com/apis) you have access to over the weekend. Hack away!\\r\
Just head over to http://developer.mashery.com/apis. Sign in using Mashery ID. Reach out to @MasheryDev if any questions. \\r\
To learn more about Intel XDK
* **Try out our API Explorer**: where you can play with and test calls on some of our public APIs before heavy-duty coding using our I/O Docs interactive documentation tool. \\r\
* **Open Source Tools & Sample Apps on [GitHub](http://mashery.github.com/)**: - Check out our GitHub \\u2013 home of our developer tools
column2: including our Intel XDK HTML5 Sample Apps and our open source I/O Docs project that you\'re welcome to contribute to. \\r\

column16: name:"Amazon Kindle Fire 24 Hour Port-A-Thon - WIPJam@MWC14"
column18: description:"**NOTE: In order to participate in this hackathon

column1: Over 75% of Android apps we\\u2019ve tested on the Kindle Fire work with no additional development required. Did you also know that you can now publish HTML5 apps and games to the Kindle Fire as well? Now is your chance to show off how great your app or game is on the Kindle Fire during this 24-hour porting event here at WIPJam.     \\r\
To participate in this event you will need to do the following things:\\r\
- Create a free Amazon Developer Account (if you don\\u2019t already have one)\\r\
- Get your Android app or game up and running on a Kindle Fire. You can use our online utility (https://developer.amazon.com/appstore/) to evaluate how much work will go into getting it working.\\r\
- If you have an HTML5 app or game
column2: you can also use our HTML5 Publishing tools (https://developer.amazon.com/public/solutions/platforms/webapps) to get it up and running on the Kindle Fire.\\r\

column1: -  Once your app or game is ready to run on Kindle Fire
column2: use our test devices to make sure everything is optimized for the Kindle Fire experience.\\r\

check out our documentation on how to get your entire dev environment setup (https://developer.amazon.com/public/resources/development-tools/ide-tools/tech-docs/01-setting-up-your-development-environment)\\r\
get your app or game ready for the store submission by filling out its details and get it uploaded and submitted to the publishing approval process.\\r\

column3: HTML5/JS running on the Kindle Fire OS\\r\

column1: - Best overall app or game running on the Kindle Fire (Android or HTML5)\\r\
- Best experience on the Kindle Fire\\r\

column2: simply have your game uploaded to your dev portal account and ready to be submitted to the store. We will test out each app or game on our devices to select the best ones being submitted to the store during the 24 hour hackathon. This event is only open to new app or game submissions.\\r\

column18: name:"Hacking Democracy - Europarl Hackathon for the European Elections 2014"
column20: description:"## Telling the story of the European Parliament - More facts

column1: It\'s likely that fewer than ever will go vote in 2014. One of the reasons is that we don\'t know what the European Parliament has achieved since the last election in 2009. We need to make its work and main achievements more visible to the voters and push people to better understand and look at the facts when casting their vote.\\r\
People might vote based on emotion
column2: but the choice should be based on information. If you think politics is nurtured on facts; if you think that your fellow citizen will become more involved in the elections if they get the chance to learn what the Parliament has actually achieved or how it has failed we are on the same page. Democracy needs informed citizens and politics would be better with more people watching and participating outside on the inner circle. The participants of the Hackathon 2014 aim at fixing just that and we want to make the Parliament more interesting and appealing ... based on facts. We know that data by itself is not interesting enough (at least not for the vast majority) - so we need activists and journalists to know what data to look for
column3: statisticians and developers to extract the relevant information
column4: and datavisualisation and user interface artists to make the facts clear and readable. And all of the above to promote the awesome stuff we\'re going to build.\\r\

column1: We need to work together to make data speak clearly - we need to work together to make politics and Europe more interesting to the voters. We need to tell the politicians we are watching
column2: and they need to run on what they\'ve done
column3: and anchor their election promises on their actions.\\r\
graphists and journalists to meet in Brussels on 24-26 January 2014 (last weekend of January) to a Hackathon.\\r\

column1: During this weekend we are going to work on several projects aiming at better telling the story of the European Parliament. We will create small groups of 2 to 4 people mixing competencies and having them generate a mini-site
column3: a chart... whatever they think is the best tool. We have experience participating in similar \\u201csprints\\u201d. It\'s intense
column4: includes very little sleep and way too much coffee
column6: resulting in lots of energy and the pleasure of having built something in a very short amount of time.\\r\

column1: We already have half a dozen signed up and we expect to be between 10 and 20. We don\'t want to make it too big
column2: as it needs to stay focussed
column3: but pretty sure I\'d love to have you joining in.\\r\

column16: description:"Reinvent 311 is challenging the developer community to find new ways to bring NYC311 info to New York City\'s 8.4 million residents.  Register today and help us connect New Yorkers with vital information about their city - anywhere

column1: Join us on Twitter - use **#Reinvent311** and shortlink **on.nyc.gov/Reinvent311**. \\r\
NYC [**311**](http://www1.nyc.gov/311/index.page) provides access to non-emergency City services and information about City government programs. 311 receives over 65
column2: 000 customer inquiries daily through its website

column1: While 311 is known as the way to submit requests and reports to City agencies
column2: 70% of customer inquiries are resolved simply by providing information.  From parking and recycling rules to birth certificates
column3: all of 311\'s content is available through an [**API**](https://www.hackerleague.org/hackathons/reinvent-311-mobile-content-challenge/wikipages/528d0dbc0f3aad4f2e000007) (application programming interface) - but it\'s not yet widely available in the mobile space.  \\r\

column2: [**Code for America**](http://codeforamerica.org/) and [**Stack Exchange**](http://stackexchange.com/) have come together to invite urban technologists
column5: civic developers and interested hackers to partner with NYC 311 to better integrate fundamental customer service information into new or existing mobile digital tools.\\r\

column1: The Global Database Global Database of Events
column3: and Tone (GDELT) is an initiative to construct a catalog of human societal-scale behavior and beliefs across all countries of the world over the last quarter-century down to the city level globally
column4: to make all of this data freely available for open research
column5: and to provide daily updates to create the first \\"realtime social sciences earth observatory.\\" \\r\

column1: Nearly a quarter-billion georeferenced events capture global behavior in more than 300 categories covering 1979 to present with daily updates. The GDELT Global Knowledge Graph (GKG) expands GDELT\'s ability to quantify global human society beyond cataloging physical occurrences towards actually representing all of the latent dimensions
column3: and network structure of the global news. It attempts to connect every person

* From the High Street A/C stop:\\r\

If \\"a\\" then cross the street and walk through the park and take a left on Cadman Plaza East - walk down the hill (past the pedestrian staircase the Brooklyn Bridge) three blocks to the intersection of Front and Washington (At Peas & Pickles market)\\r\

column18: description:"This year\'s edition of the [java2days conference](http://2013.java2days.com/) hosts an OpenJDK hackaton whose mission is to establish a collaborative environment for developers willing to learn
column19: share knowledge and contribute to critical areas of the OpenJDK platform and provide ideas for the future development of the OpenJDK ecosystem.\\r\

column1: During the conference there will be two technical sessions (one in the first day and another one - in the second day) that will cover the details around the Adopt OpenJDK initiative and the internals of the Hotspot JVM. \\r\
Another two sessions will be held during the hands-on labs covering modification of JDK source code
column2: writing JTReg tests and working with lambdas.\\r\

column1: During the two days of the hackaton each participant may contribute patches/documentation/ideas for different categories. For each of the categories there will be a set of guidelines provided by the organizers used to aid participants. The categories are as follows:\\r\
- reverse engineer part of a project and create document or presentation that describes it \\r\
- extend a project with sample new feature\\r\
- provide tests for feature(s) in a specific project\\r\
- tune performance of a feature in a project\\r\
- create a customized version of the JVM\\r\
- provide ideas for new algorithms and collections to the core JDK libraries\\r\
- provide ideas for new JSRs and projects in the ecosystem \\r\
A typical flow for any of the above activities is as follows:\\r\
+ a participants selects an activity and starts working (source patches in the form of diff files are submitted to ReviewBoard for codereview
column2: ideas are being outlined in a shared document/presentation and documentation is outlined in a shared document)\\r\

column1: + if a participant has difficulty with any of the activities he may ask a mentor or other participant for help (via the IRC channel
column2: the shared whiteboard or the shared source code editor depending on the type of activity)\\r\

column1: + mentors should review all of the submitted items (documents/presentations/patches) and store them in the shared storage space after being finalized.\\r\
At the end of the second hackday results are announced and participants are awarded.\\r\
Many thanks to the sponsors of the event for providing the awards for the most active participants:\\r\

[Dropbox storage](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/fz4ctew8luky3s5/zp73G7I-yN) - storage space used by the mentors to collect results from the participants - explicit permission for access should be requested by other participants"
column17: description:"A 6-Core Mac Pro prize will be given to best submission. Exceptional contenders will be considered for an on-site interview at Clover\'s offices in Mountain View.\\r\

column1: Say for some reason that a credit card processor was using SHA-1 hashes of credit card numbers (\\"PANs\\")\\u2014perhaps trying to \\"securely\\" identify cards without using card numbers\\u2014and accidentally spilled some out. Pretend you\'re a criminal and want to reverse those PAN hashes to raw PANs.\\r\

We provide a dataset of hashed PANs (completely fictionalized!) and your job is to produce the matching PANs. We also provide a set of PANs a criminal happened to have lying around\\u2014figure out if this is useful to you.\\r\
Come up an algorithmically efficient implementation that minimizes work assuming a single core. Bonus points for efficiently using any/all cores you have at your disposal.\\r\

column2: and issue a pull request when you\'re ready to submit. Include your description what the execution time is for your program and what kind of hardware you\'re running it on.\\r\

column1: An inescapable paradox of the 21st century is that the faster we go

column1: RhoMobile Suite is a powerful HTML5 application development framework that lets you create consumer and enterprise applications to deploy on smartphones
column3: regardless of the operating system. Based on web development languages (HTML5 and CSS3)
column5: feel and act the same on every device.\\r\

column1: There will be a choice of developer challenges for the hackathon and you may enter more than one challenge.\\r\
Challenge Category One \\u2013 Freeform feature-rich Enterprise App\\r\
Can be created for any enterprise class device

Use Rhodes to develop an app for any mainstream consumer smartphone or tablet.\\r\
Can be created for any iOS/Android device/Blackberry\\r\
Use some of the device\'s features such as the camera or GPS\\r\
Challenge Category Three \\u2013 Windows Phone App\\r\
Use Rhodes to develop an app for any WP7 or WP8 smartphone\\r\
Use some device features such as camera\\r\
PRESENT YOUR APP TO THE JUDGES AND THE AUDIENCE\\r\
All those entering will be given just a few minutes to present their app on the 6th November at the end of the Hackathon.\\r\
PRIZES FOR WINNING APPS \\u2013 THE CONTEST\\r\
The most innovative apps in each challenge category will be announced and awarded prizes during the Games and Networking event on the 6th November.\\r\

column2: Ingenuity and best use of RhoMobile Suite."

Do you have an app that is missing some pieces and you want to interface with partners to get them?  Do you have an app that\\u2019s a great idea but it\\u2019s going to need 24/7 monitoring and management to ever be real?  Do you want to learn how to use communications services to improve your apps? \\r\

column3: is exploring a new set of APIs and new concepts for how apps will be created and managed
column4: so it is about learning as much as it is about hacking.  We will have expert mentors and code examples
column5: so you can Hack and Learn together.\\r\

column1: We\\u2019ve teamed with Apigee to build a platform where you can mash up products out of functions exposed by other companies using open APIs.  So not only can you develop apps much faster using that are already built
column2: but you can assemble them in your own unique
column3: creative way - from a taxi broker to eHealth remote patient monitoring and everything in between.  Also key for these kinds of apps is monitoring and management 24x7 across the end-to-end service. We\\u2019ve got that covered with our APIs

column1: Lead developers of these APIs will be on hand to help you succeed: you\'ll work with teams of engineers from companies like Cisco
column2: Ericsson and Orange.  But we\'ll also listen to you
column3: telling us what works and what does not.\\r\

column1: And let\\u2019s not forget the prizes: up to $6

Our APIs come from our years of experience in management and were designed and created by experts (our TM Forum members) who have spent their whole careers thinking about this stuff.  They took their expertise and packaged it into a set of REST APIs to change the way management happens.\\r\
* Trouble Ticketing API:  When something fails anywhere in the value chain
The Vision:  What if you could get trouble tickets as Tweets? \\r\
* Product Catalog API: Find and share functional components with partners in the value chain to create new services seamlessly.\\r\
API Functions: Share product and pricing information from your catalog; seek products and services from other catalog owners; create product bundles\\r\
The Vision:  Imagine if you could create new products in 3 clicks?\\r\

* Partner Ordering API: This is the heart of product mash-ups. Turn product catalog items into your latest business venture by ordering them from their owners and mashing them into your hot new offering.  Conversely
column2: you can sell something to your partners

column1: The Vision: Imagine if time to market from concept to fruition was under an hour?\\r\
* Simple Management API: Like the name says
column2: this one makes it simple to see the health of an app.  Is it working? Is anything broken? \\r\

column1: API Functions: Report on app status; report failures; register for notification of changes; collect measurements; register for notification of status changes;\\r\

column2: one view of a service health.  How cool would that be?\\r\

column1: What kinds of services might you hack?\\r\
There is a class of services out there that need managing \\u2013 and by managing we mean full time babysitting.  You absolutely must know if they are working right
column2: how they are performing and if they are doing what they are designed to do 24x7.   And doing that is hard enough when you are just minding your own services
column3: but imagine if you add partners in the mix and if you are relying on a service provider or other company to provide you critical capabilities.  You need to know that you can see end-to-end what is happening at all times.  No excuses allowed.\\r\

column1: * You can run a startup by building the apps supporting these open APIs for large service providers\\r\
* You can use the APIs to build applications that you resell to other service providers\\r\
* You can build mobile apps that use these APIs\\r\
* Use the TM Forum APIs to access and benefit from Service Provider Digital Services Offerings available today and mash them up to provide robust applications in eHealth
column3: financial services or any other high availability service\\r\

column1: * Develop new apps that act as clients in enriching the Service Provider Web APIs\\r\
* Develop apps implementing the APIs with backend plugged into social networks\\r\
The possibilities are endless and they are all based on ubiquitous Web and TM Forum REST APIs.\\r\

There is an attended garage on 12th Street
column3: on Kissling. The closest MUNI stop is Van Ness
column8: 27 and more. The closest BART stop is Civic Center. \\r\

column1: What can/can\'t I bring to the event?\\r\

Bring a laptop and don\'t forget your charger! Also recommended: a toothbrush! And be sure to come prepared with a little knowledge on the API ecosystem to tighten the learning curve and win cash money! \\r\
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?\\r\
No. Please do not. We can check you in online. \\r\
No refunds are available but you may transfer your ticket once."

column33: description:"Trans*H4CK is the world\'s first Hackathon focused on creating technology that benefits the transgender community.\\r\

column1: Research shows that transgender people are unemployed at 2x the national rate\\u20134x for transgender people of color; have incomes of less than $10
column2: 000 a year; experience homelessness at 2x the rate of non-trans people; and suffer overwhelming discrimination when it comes to accessing adequate healthcare and legal services. This problem not only affects transgender adults but trans and gender nonconforming youth as well. \\r\

column1: The goal of Trans*H4CK is to create new tech resources that benefit the trans and gender non conforming communities in the following ways:\\r\
Promote economic advancement and financial sustainability\\r\
Promote attention to or improve services for trans people without homes
Support the overall wellbeing of the community\\r\

column1: _We use the following metrics when scoring applications:_\\r\
- **DESIGN** - Is the application visually appealing and simple to use?\\r\
- **EFFECTIVE USE OF API** - Does the application use the interfaces provided by Box and Developer Garden?\\r\
- **USEFULNESS** - Does the application have a specific purpose that makes it attractive?\\r\
- **ORIGINALITY** - Is the application innovative and appealing because it is unique?\\r\
- **FUSION POWER** - Does the application combine Developer Garden and Box APIs? Pay attention \\u2013 you can win extra Brownie points here!\\r\

**First step**: Make sure you save your free ticket on the official site of [Lange Nacht der Startups](http://www.startupnight.de/en/programm/hackathon.html \\"Lange Nacht der Startups: Hackathon\\") to participate in the hackathon.\\r\

column18: description:"Twilio and Autism Speaks are partnering up to host a 24 hour hackathon at the new Twilio HQ!\\r\

column2: 1 in 88 children are diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder (ASD)
column3: up from 1 in 150 in 2000. That 1 in 150 are now entering the workforce
column4: applying to colleges and trying to find housing just like the rest of us adults
column5: but they have the added challenges that come with having ASD. At this hackathon
column6: the objective will be on solving the big and the day-to-day issues that adults and individuals transitioning from school or services with autism spectrum disorder face. Let\\u2019s come together to create solutions to these challenges!\\r\

column1: Don\\u2019t worry if you don\\u2019t have programming skills!\\r\
The event is open to anyone who wants to be involved! We need subject matter experts
column4: information architects and everyone who wants to use technology to make a difference in the lives of those on the autism spectrum.\\r\

column2: the snacks and beverages. You provide your talents and technology. We recommend that you bring a laptop if you plan on developing or designing. We will have speakers and a presntation of ideas at the end.\\r\
but more importantly you\'ll be part of a discussion that could improve the lives of those who are struggling with these issues.\\r\

column1: Partners and speakers will be announced as we get close to the date of the evet.\\r\

1. Employment - Employers need to know the accomodations that they should make for those with autism and the employee needs to kow how to clearly communcate those needs. It could be something that the person could reference for tips on how to behave in an office. It could be a tracking app for the job coach. It could even be a service that helped to craft a form letter with accomodations in it that was a clear and appropriate business communication.\\r\

2. Post Secondary Education - It\'s hard to ask for help and many people with autism in school just don\'t ask for the accomodations that they need to flourish in the classroom to avoid the social situation of approsching the professor. Professors need to be made aware in a clear
column3: way of what those needs are. This could cover tips for new social situations on campus like working in groups or getting help at the library. \\r\

column1: 3. Dating/Relationships - This would address  sexuality issues
column2: and a lot of adults with ASD don\\u2019t feel they understand what is expected of them on a date
column3: what they should do and talk about
column4: what is ok and what is inappropriate
column5: how they should ask for what they want
column6: and how to behave. Many people with ASD also have repetitve behavoirs or trouble maintaining eye contact and this can be off putting to those who might not understand it at the beginning. What is the best way to communicate that on a first date? \\r\

column1: 4. Roommates - Can you help connect adults with ASD to other adults w/ASD looking for compatible roommates (location
5. Appropriate Behavoirs - Many people with ASD have trouble monitoring how loud they are
column3: how close they are to other people and they often times use repetitive behavoirs called \\"stimming\\" to help them remain calm especially in stressful stiuations. \\r\

column1: The Evernote Devcup is our annual developer competition for designers and software developers. With the help of our online community
column2: we will award prizes to the best products that integrate with the Evernote API. \\r\

column1: # *Build the next generation of memorable apps using the Evernote platform.*\\r\
Participants will be working on building apps and services that effectively use features within the Evernote service.\\r\
For all documentation on programming using the Evernote service
*We use the following metrics when scoring applications:*\\r\
* **EFFECTIVE USE OF EVERNOTE API -** Does the application take advantage of the unique functionality offered by the Evernote platform?\\r\
* **UTILITY -** Is the application compelling and/or indispensable?\\r\
* **ORIGINALITY -** Is the application unique and/or innovative?\\r\
All eligible apps must be submitted **no later than 11:59 PM on July 5th
column2: 2013**. Each submission must include a brief description and a 2-3 minute video demo. No app may participate if it has released a public integration with Evernote prior to March 10th
column3: 2013. Please check out our [full list of rules](https://www.hackerleague.org/hackathons/evernote-devcup-2013/wikipages/513798a64d7157bb96000060) and a brief list of [best practices](https://www.hackerleague.org/hackathons/evernote-devcup-2013/wikipages/51af8fc059b2a17378000041).\\r\

* Surprise awards from partners Honda Silicon Valley Lab

column20: description:"An Idea Jam on Information Technologies in Industrial Ecology\\r\

column1: Find collaborators. Win Prizes. Gain recognition for your ideas. At this year\\u2019s SIEYP III Conference we are trying something new. The SIEYP 2013 Ad-hock-a-thon is prize competition to demonstrate the impact of applying Information and Communications Technologies (ICT\\u2019s) for research
column2: policy and business ideas in Industrial Ecology. This is a chance for researchers
column5: designers and business professionals in the field of industrial ecology to find like-minded colleagues and forge future collaborations to solve some of our biggest sustainability challenges.\\r\

column1: We are planning this interactive brainstorming event in the style of a \\u201chack-a-thon.\\u201d Hack-a-thon\\u2019s are taking the tech and start-up communities by storm. Hack-a-thons bring technology innovators and developers together in an intense multi-day workshop to pitch projects

The Ad-Hock-a-thon will focus on SIEYP\\u2019s 2013 theme \\u201cApplying IE Research towards Transitions.\\u201d Many young professionals may already have ideas for innovative uses of ICT\\u2019s in Industrial Ecology. Many other ideas may arise during the ISIE Ulsan conference. Keep your eyes
column2: ears and minds open for interesting uses of ICT\\u2019s in: \\r\

column1: \\u2022 Urban Infrastructure and Low Carbon Development\\r\
\\u2022 Life Cycle Sustainability Assessment and Modeling\\r\

The Green Ad-Hoc-A-Thon will be a two part event to facilitate deeper brainstorming and meaningful outcomes. The first session will held Thursday evening June 27th during the ISIE Conference (International Hall Room 407
column3: and the second session will be held June 29th during SIEYP III. \\r\

column1: Here are the Ideas from the Ad Hoc Jam - Thursday June 28 - http://goo.gl/teIaY\\r\

Since there are so many of you who may want to take some time on Saturday to further develop ideas \\u2013  (and that we aim to keep the breakout sessions to a max of 10 people each) we have tentatively made 2 Ad Hoc breakout sessions in the schedule. Morning (Ad Hoc A) and Afternoon (Ad Hoc B).  Have a look at SIEYP.org for your preferred workshops and add Hoc A or Hoc B next to the project idea you will be working on.  Please only sign up for A or B tomorrow. "

column16: description:"Deutsche Telekom is hosting a Hackathon in Berlin to mark the opening of its Launchpad startup space in Berlin. The Hackathon will feature APIs from Evernote and Telekom\'s developer ecosystem DeveloperGarden.\\r\

column1: *We use the following metrics when scoring applications:*\\r\
* **EFFECTIVE USE OF API -** Does the application take advantage of the unique functionality offered by the Evernote or Developer Garden platform?\\r\
* **UTILITY -** Is the application compelling and/or indispensable?\\r\
* **ORIGINALITY -** Is the application unique and/or innovative?\\r\
* **FUSION POWER -** The combined implementation of Evernote and Developer Garden APIs will boost your application score!\\r\
* **First step:** Make sure to RSVP for the Event on [hackdt.com](http://hackdt-es2004.eventbrite.com/#)\\r\
* Go to [dev.evernote.com](http://dev.evernote.com/#apikey) to [register your API key](http://dev.evernote.com/#apikey)
column3: and start building on our sandbox environment. [Review the getting started guide »](https://www.hackerleague.org/hackathons/deutsche-telekom-and-evernote-berlin-hackathon/wikipages/5153f6f9809d46cacb000046)\\r\

column3: read the [documentation of the API](https://www.developergarden.com/en/apis/) you want to implement in your application.\\r\

column17: description:"2013 is the first year the conference will be hosting a Hackathon alongside the main tracks and late into Friday night. There will be prizes awarded throughout the Hackathon for the most innovative hacks and the winner will get two free tickets to next year\\u2019s conference
column22: the opportunity to present their hack on the main stage after the final keynote panel to all the delegates.\\r\

column1: This year\'s Hackthon is sponsored by [Pusher](http://pusher.com) and [Twilio](http://twilio.com).\\r\
The Web is now much more than a static set of entities representing unchanging information. It\'s now our main communication platform with the ability to integrate realtime messaging

For this hackathon we want to see the web used as a true realtime communication platform. By using your PHP skills along with Pusher and Twilio\'s awesome APIs we can\'t wait to see what you build.\\r\
The Hackathon will consists of a main hack on Friday night with demos and the main prize awarded on Saturday.\\r\

We encourage you to use the space for hacking on your own projects - *you don\'t have to take part in the main hackaton*. If you happen to build something cool with Pusher and/or Twilio at any point during the conference there are prizes to be won. More information below.\\r\
The hackerspace will be open and available for general hacking between 09:30 on Friday 22nd and 16:30 on Saturday 23rd.\\r\
Whilst we encourage you to enter the main hackathon you are free to use the space to chill and hack on your own projects. Please do have a chat with the guys from Pusher and Twilio.\\r\

* **18:00** - Main Realtime Communications hack will commence including API talks from Pusher and Twilio and hack submissions can begin. Use this time to get access to the folks from Pusher and Twilio.\\r\
* **11:30** - Realtime communications hack submissions deadline. Ensure you have created your project in Hacker League.\\r\
* **12:40** - Each team that has entered will get to demo their hack. How much time will depend on how many teams have entered.\\r\
The backspace will remain open for general hacking and chilling until 16:30.\\r\
* The winning entry must use both Pusher and Twilio\'s APIs\\r\
* The hack must have been built during PHP Conference 2013\\r\
* In order to enter the hackathon and be eligible to win you must register your team and hack with Hacker League and present your demo on Saturday 22nd February in the hack space.\\r\
* We reserve the right to make other reasonable entry rules without notice (just in case we\'ve forgotten anything obvious above)\\r\
The winning team of the main hackathon will receive:\\r\
* Each team member will receive 6 months Startup plan access to Pusher\\r\
* Each team member will receive a [Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/) from Twilio\\r\
* Each team member will receive an [AeroPress](http://aerobie.com/products/aeropress.htm) from Pusher\\r\
* 1 month free on the 3-month or 6-month subscription to [Bean & Ground Coffee](http://www.beanandground.co.uk \\"Monthly subscription coffee club - Bean & Ground\\")\\r\
We want to make the hack space comfortable so that if you can use the space for hacking on your own projects. We want to encourage you to do this. However
column2: if you build any kind of mini-hack with Pusher or Twilio please let us know as there are additional prizes to be won for building anything that we think is cool or useful.\\r\

column1: * 1 month free on the 3-month or 6-month subscription to [Bean & Ground Coffee](http://www.beanandground.co.uk \\"Monthly subscription coffee club - Bean & Ground\\") [![](https://www.beanandground.co.uk/images/logo-large.png \\"Monthly subscription coffee club - Bean & Ground\\")](https://www.beanandground.co.uk)\\r\
* Other prizes that we haven\'t yet bought or thought about"

column17: description:"The DeveloperWeek API+Mashups Hackathon is a 43-hour app-building contest in downtown San Francisco from Friday February 1st until Sunday February 3rd - and is also the official kick-off of [DeveloperWeek 2013](www.developerweek.com)! column19: and entrepreneurs the chance to pitch app ideas - form teams - build a prototype of their app - and present to our hackathon judges for a chance to be one of the top 5 hackathon winners who get \\"incubated\\" during DeveloperWeek.\\r\

column1: You can build any app you want to - however you get \'extra points\' from the judges if your app integrates an external API. That can be anything from google maps or twitter OAuth to one of our sponsor\'s API\'s!\\r\

column3: and cash to help \\u2018incubate\\u2019 their app into a viable startup company by the Wednesday of DeveloperWeek. These 5 hackathon winners then compete again on-stage on Wednesday February 6th of DeveloperWeek so our community can help launch your startup!\\r\

column17: description:"Democracy is not inevitable or a given; it must be sustained and strengthened by each generation. Today

column1: Do you have an idea for an app that will improve this fall\'s election?  What tools do we need to improve citizen engagement? What data would make your local city council and board of elections more transparent?  This is where you can outline your idea.\\r\

column1: * 11:30: Session: Introduction to Building JavaScript and HTML5 Applications for Windows 8 \\u2013 Tools
* 17:00 Friday Happy Hour and wrap up\\r\
###What to bring or prepare in advance?###\\r\

* Your own laptop with [Windows 8 Consumer Preview installed](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-8/download). You can use [dual boot on Windows](http://www.afterdawn.com/news/article.cfm/2012/03/01/quick_guide_to_installing_windows_8_consumer_preview_in_dual-boot)
column4: or [install as a virtual machine using VirtualBox](http://www.redmondpie.com/install-windows-8-consumer-preview-in-virtualbox-virtual-machine-on-mac-windows-7-how-to-tutorial/)\\r\

column1: * Install [Visual Studio 11 Express for Windows 8](http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/11/en-us/downloads#express-win8) (free version) on top of your Windows 8 environment.\\r\

column1: The Wall Street Journal is inviting developers to help build free Web tools that promote data transparency and control.\\r\
What do we mean by \\"data transparency and control\\"?\\r\
One of the fastest-growing businesses in the world is the use of your data. When you browse the Internet
column2: your movements are recorded by hundreds of tracking companies. When you walk down the street
column3: your cellphone is transmitting your location. Items you post on Facebook and Twitter are being monitored by employers

column1: The Wall Street Journal documented the concerns raised by this surveillance in its \\u201cWhat They Know\\u201d series. Now
column2: the Journal is seeking to promote tools that let people see and control their personal data. Over three crisp spring days in New York
column3: the Journal will host about a hundred developers at its first-ever Data Transparency Weekend. The programmers will form teams to work on free Web tools that promote data transparency; at the end of the weekend
column4: the best tools will win prizes and be publicly recognized."

column18: description:"BeMyApp Mobile Olympics is a three-day mobile app hackathon which brings together the most creative developers
column20: marketers and ideas people to collaborate on building a working mobile app prototype.  Whatever your background
column21: you can use the weekend to: \\r\

column1: a). get a team around your app idea
column2: build the prototype and receive instant feedback on the project\\r\

column1: b). discover and try out amazing app development tools and APIs\\r\
c). meet fantastic people you could start a new venture with\\r\
d). have a great time learning new skills at break-neck speed\\r\
e). get involved and enhance your chances of winning a great prize(s)\\r\
f). gain global media coverage for your prototype\\r\
Registered idea generators (from any background) are given 1 minute to pitch an app concept on Friday evening to an audience filled with fellow idea generators
There\\u2019s a flurry of activity as the idea generators look to form teams around their app idea.  At the end of all the networking and bargaining
column2: we announce the ideas that will be made into working prototypes and the competition begins!\\r\

column1: Teams start working immediately. Teams work throughout the weekend
column2: with a big chunk taking place on Saturday
column3: to build working mobile app prototypes which they present to our panel of judges on Sunday evening.  A big basket of fantastic prizes are then given out for the best and most creative apps which will help the most successful teams take their apps to market. \\r\

column1: But it doesn\\u2019t stop there!  This year

column17: description:"The HackPrinceton initiative of the Princeton Entrepreneurship Club presents Start Week \\u2013 stay on campus for intersession and build a prototype that could form the basis of a startup in just a week
column18: all the while getting mentored by big time entrepreneurs and attending classes with some of the best programmers and designers in the industry. You\\u2019ll get hands-on experience with both the technical and business aspects of doing a startup
column19: and you\\u2019ll add an awesome project to your portfolio.\\r\

column1: ##I\\u2019m not sure whether I want to get a job/internship or work on my own startup. Is this for me?\\r\
Regardless of whether you want to actually build a startup
column3: or simply find a great internship (or job)
column4: this week will be super useful. Lots of companies (especially startups) ask you to show them something you\\u2019ve built. This is a chance to not only have something to show
column5: but something that\\u2019s truly awesome and polished.\\r\

column1: ##What is the timeline of the event?\\r\
HackPrinceton Start Week kicks off with its welcome event Sunday
column2: January 29th. Classes and talks run from Sunday to Friday
column5: and teams demo their products Sunday
column6: February 5th. If you are unable to make demo day or the day before
column8: but teams should be present for the first 6 days of Start Week.\\r\

column1: ##What if I don\\u2019t have a team yet?\\r\
If you would like to meet others to form a team or would like to learn more
column2: we will be having a mix-n-mingle and kickoff event.\\r\

column1: ##Do I have to be a programmer or designer?\\r\
You do not have to be a programmer or designer
column2: but should be on a team with at least one. See the question above.\\r\

column1: We encourage you to enter both this event and TigerLaunch
column2: as there is enormous synergy between the programs (hack during StartWeek
column4: then apply for accelerators). Think of this as a track designed to prepare you for entrepreneurship out in the wild or an awesome summer internship (or job). You\\u2019ve got what it takes. Now take the next step and make it happen."

column15: description:"RHoK Princeton is a part of RHoK\'s Global December Hackathon. Be a part of the global movement and come join developers

column1: Hackers: Come use your skills to make the world a better place!\\r\
Visionaries: Do you have an awesome idea that could impact the world but don\'t have the means to build it out? Come to the event and team up with other hackers to turn your idea into reality.\\r\

Non-profits/NGOs: Do you have a pressing problem that you think a bunch of smart hackers could help solve? column1: X-Calibre Hackathon is a one-day Windows Phone application building contest (9am - 6pm) happening on November 19
column2: 2011 where developers compete to create the best WP app using Mango features such as  Metro UI

column1: Judging will be done by representatives from Nokia
column3: and the WP Champs.  There will be no criteria weightage.  Judging will simply be based on \\"the best Windows Phone app that uses Mango features such as Metro UI

column1: 1. The chosen 60 participants will be divided into 4 groups each stationed at different locations.  Groups will compose of teams with maximum 3 members each team.  In total there will be 20 teams.\\r\
2. Two Windows Phone Champs will be managing and providing technical support to each of the groups.  In total there will be 8 Champs.\\r\

3.  The contest will commence at 9:00 am simultaneously throughout the locations.  The Champs will be on-location until 6pm.  Venue is only available until 6:00 pm.  Contest (submission) ends 11:59 pm on the same day.\\r\
5. Contest winners will be announced at the Awarding event in Nokia Singapore (date to be confirmed)"

column20: description:"Welcome to the hackNY Fall 2011 Hackathon! hackNY organizes once-a-semester student \\u2018hackathons\\u2019: 24-hour coding events in which NYC startups present their technologies and students build original applications based on them.
